page.title: 02GENERAL OVERVIEW 2
page.content: To the South West lie the small villages of Little Warley, with its 'Greyhound' public house, and Childerditch, hidden away in its quiet rural cul-de-sac off Childerditch Lane. From the top of Jury Hill in the south a panoramic view of the Thames Estuary and the hills of Kent can be had on a clear day and looking to the West the London skyline some 25 miles away can be seen. For those who enjoy a round of golf, three Golf Clubs are available; two private, Thorndon Park and Warley Park, and one public to the North at Hart's Wood Park. The farmland at the centre is dominated by the unusual collonaded farm buildings of Hatch Farm
